result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Edward S Kerchefski in court with attorney Annette M Barna.  Defendant Edward S Kerchefski in custody.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 15CM149. both Init App-  Waive reading of the CC, enter plea of NG to misdemeanor counts.  Heard along with 14CM87, 15CF14,15CF15,15CF16,15CF22,15CF101,15CF123.  Court recites case settlement into the court record.  Court instructs on plea questionnaire/waiver of rights.  

14CM87-
15CF14-
15CF15-Ct 1-NC   Court will accept and find the DE guilty.  
15CF16-Ct1 NC
15CF22-CT 1 NC
15CF101-
15CF123- 
All other counts/cases will be DRI.  

COURT WILL ORDER A PSI BE PREPARED.  Atty asking that DE be released pending prep of PSI.  DE will be tranported to Barron for CS warrant.  $5000.00 sign bond, no contacts from all bonds will remain.  Set for sentencing 11-30-15 @ 2:00PM.

Defendant is not to consume or possess alcohol.  Do not enter premises where alcohol is primary business, any bars taverns or liquor stores.   No possession or use of mind altering substances, or illicit substances.  DE must be at residence from 10:00PM to 6:00 am every day.
Paperwork filed by G.K. completed with assistance of TO Shelter.

Defendant Edward S Kerchefski in court with attorney Annette M Barna.  Defendant Edward S Kerchefski in custody.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DE waives PH hearing, court instructs on waiver of PH hearing.  Court will accept waiver.  Court finds probable cause exists, will bind over for JT. Victim has completed the TO shelter program, court will lift the no contact provision, contact will be physically and verbally abuse free.  Will set court date tommorrow after other cases are heard.
